ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate their almsfood picking from a heap. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not eat almsfood picking from a heap,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.4_0: Almsfood should not be eaten picking from a heap.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood picking from a heap, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.11_0: if only a little food remains and he eats it after collecting it in one place and then eats it;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.15_0: The fifth training rule is finished.
